title.narrative: Assistance to Charity House Network in East Georgia

description.narrative: The Assistance to Charity House Network in East Georgia Project will be implemented in three neighboring villages (Shilda, Eniseli and Sabue) of Kvareli municipality. It will provide assistance to a total of 135 individuals and 60 families. The main objective of the project is to help the Charity House Network in the development of a hog enterprise owned by Abibo Likreseli Shilda Charity House. The primary activity of the Charity House is to provide free meals to 135 impoverished persons living in thee neighboring villages. The establishment of a small-scale hog farm will enable Charity House to improve the food rations of people who visit the free canteens that are operated by the Charity House on a daily basis. In the first year of the project, Heifer Georgia will provide the Charity House with 15 sows, which will assist 40 individuals. The sows will be kept together on the hog farm operated by the Charity House. Keeping animals in one isolated place will minimize risks related to infectious diseases and ensure adequate veterinary treatment. The piggery will serve as a “piglet incubator,” where the sows during the project period will be kept, and delivered piglets will be shared with project participants through Heifer’s Pass on the Gift process. The piggery building already exists, though it needs some renovations, which will be subsidized by Heifer Georgia. Some of the piglets will be marketed and sold by the Charity House, and the income generated will be used to purchase staple foods for the free canteen clients. An additional 95 individuals and 60 families will benefit from Heifer’s “Passing on the Gift” process. The Project Holder’s contribution to the project will include piggery building and construction of water supply and sewage system. The sewage system will prevent environmental contamination and worsening of ecological degradation at the project site. Charity House staff will take turns caring for the animals according to a prearranged schedule. Over four years, with the assistance of Heifer Georgia, the Charity House Network will create a successful hog enterprise.
